function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Neglecting the impact of buildings on climate change, resources, and ecosystems","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promotion of self-interested behavior by standard-based systems","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Standardization leading to homogenized human experience and expectation","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the impact of building design on contagious disease propagation","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in outcomes due to co-evolutionary dynamics of people, socio-cultural, and ecological systems","category":"Performance (equity, resilience, self-sufficiency)","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate accommodation of regional distinctions and local ecosystems in green assessment methods","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited focus on understanding and engaging local ecosystems and their processes","category":"Environment","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tight time and budgetary constraints in building design","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for socio-ecological system impact","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex systems and uncertain environments can lead to unpredictable outcomes, including the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deployment of energy-intensive technologies","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dissemination of design and development practices","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of synchronization between scientific representation and social meaning","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ambiguity and overlap in top-down and bottom-up approaches","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of engagement and interaction between design professionals, communities, and stakeholders in implementing regenerative practices","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for contagious disease propagation in built environments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagion due to close proximity and interaction of building inhabitants.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substitution of human agency with automated intelligence may lead to reduced awareness and proactive behavior towards disease prevention.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain weather systems and resource availability may impact building design and infrastructure, influencing disease transmission dynamics.","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of prioritization of public health concerns in design decisions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climate change impacting social goals and built environment","category":"Performance (equity, resilience, self-sufficiency)","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex systems comprehension and reductionist science","category":"Performance (equity, resilience, self-sufficiency)","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cultural resistance to new approaches","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Boundaries and property lines defining and protecting private ownership can constrain the expansion of professional responsibilities and practices in the built environment, hindering the integration of cooperative networked infrastructure.","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diversity in social and economic equity, demographics, and proximity to services create spatial heterogeneity in urban and suburban areas, impacting disease propagation patterns.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inherent tension between mechanistic, reductive scientific paradigms in green building design and emerging regenerative development approaches may impact the effectiveness of disease mitigation strategies in built environments.","category":"Performance (equity, resilience, self-sufficiency)","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on day-to-day actions for adaptation to climate change","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on community behaviors and values","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential confusion bias in effect estimation due to differences in behavior and adherence levels across various populations","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited restrictions on personal outings and on-site work during certain periods may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear vaccine coverage and transmission rate","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex mathematical modeling of disease transmission and estimation procedures.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Treating the population intercept as an empirical mean over the population members","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coupling of dynamics across regions in the population-based estimate","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of prior knowledge to force variables in the population to be constant","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correction of errors in initial conditions over time","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assuming a time-dependent function for the wiener process may lead to inaccurate estimation of the transmission rate.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overfitting the model could lead to inaccurate distinctions between the latent trajectory of transmission rate and noise in observations.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using a constant transmission rate assumption before the first lockdown may not accurately capture the changing transmission dynamics.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear prior for dynamics of b may lead to inaccuracies in model predictions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of linear mixed effects model may not accurately represent the complexity of disease transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to account for all influencing factors in the epidemic model","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of overfitting due to inclusion of multiple interaction effects","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interpreting seasonal weather effects on transmission rates may lead to false assumptions about disease control","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission rate estimates may lead to over-estimation or under-estimation of the actual transmission rate, impacting the effectiveness of control measures.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Under-reporting during weekends may lead to misleading transmission rate estimates, affecting the accuracy of disease spread predictions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in epidemic baseline conditions, such as the number of exposed and infectious cases, can impact the accuracy of transmission rate estimates and disease spread modeling.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between non-pharmaceutical interventions npis and transmission rates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased transmission during winter period by 10%","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased transmission during summer period by 22%","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
